thread.title: Rider lassoes women’s links title at Adams
thread.title_full: Rider lassoes women’s links title at Adams

title: Rider lassoes women’s links title at Adams
text:
Rider lassoes women’s links title at Adams By Mike Tupa mtupa@examiner-enterprise.com 
Peggy Rider dug in her spurs of determination and galloped on a pony of momentum to the Adams Women’s Golf Association Club Championship title. 
After shooting 84 in last week’s opening round of the 36-hole event, Rider coursed to an 81, during the final session Thursday, to edge past first-round leader Cindy Facker for the crown. 
Rider whittled out a total of 165 (81-84), followed by Facker at 166 (80-86) and Marge Harvey at 179 (87-92). 
Rider earned the title of overall champion, while Facker won the Championship Flight gross scoring honor. 
On the net side, Darla Howe emerged as the overall champion. She fashioned a 139 (70-69). 
Pam Bonifield made an impressive second-round rally to harvest the net first place in the Championship Flight. She finished with 150 (81-69). 
Kathy Brown (158, 82-76) also boasted a notable improvement in the second round to finish second in the Championship Flight. 
A Flight 
Cindy Eads (187, 90-97) nailed down the gross title, followed by Sue Meiler (199, 99-100). 
Felicia Nelson proved to be consistent in both rounds on her way to first in the net division (146, 72-74). 
But, Debbie Wood could have been more balanced in her output. She shot 76-76 (152) to come in second in the net scoring 
B Flight 
Barbara Oldham and Willy Polk duked it out for the gross scoring crown. 
Oldham (211, 103-108) won by two strokes, as Polk came in at 213 (107-106). 
Adrene Linehan claimed the net championship, with 147 (73-74). Rules for posting comments
